WorkItem.Description:
I'm trying to send HTML email from a PHP script in IIS 7.5 and Windows 7 Professional 64 bit. Smtp4dev is not receiving the messages, although it shows the session with 0 messages after 30 sec time-out. The same script worked correctly in the SMTP virtual server in IIS 5 on Windows XP Professional and produced emails that I could view on Outlook and Outlook Express.
This is the log:
 
220 localhost smtp4dev ready
HELO SUPER
250 Nice to meet you
MAIL FROM:<laura@gmail.com>
250 Okey dokey
RCPT TO:<papitu@gmail.com>
250 Recipient accepted
RSET
 
and this is the message, located at C:\windows\temp:
 
Date: Sun, 22 May 2011 09:44:20 +0200
Subject: Cambio de la clave de acceso de LEDMaster®
To: papitu@gmail.com
From: laura@gmail.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-type: text/html; charset=iso-8859-1
X-Mailer: super with PHP 5.3.6
 
<html><head><title>Cambio de la clave de acceso de LEDMaster®</title><meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1"><style type="text/css"> [ ...some well-formed CSS style... ]</style></head><body>[ ...some well-formed HTML content... ]</body></html>
 
Thanks in advance for a clarifying response.

Comments.Message:
I was doing more tests and I realized that Norton Internet Security 2011 could be blocking the mail generated by my PHP application as if it were spam. Disabling mail scanning, stmp4dev crashes with the following error report:

Description:
  Stopped working

Problem signature:
  Problem Event Name:	CLR20r3
  Problem Signature 01:	smtp4dev.exe
  Problem Signature 02:	2.0.5.0
  Problem Signature 03:	4be9ca2f
  Problem Signature 04:	Rnwood.SmtpServer
  Problem Signature 05:	2.0.5.0
  Problem Signature 06:	4be9ca2b
  Problem Signature 07:	16
  Problem Signature 08:	0
  Problem Signature 09:	System.IndexOutOfRangeException
  OS Version:	6.1.7600.2.0.0.256.48
  Locale ID:	1027
